steps: Do not re-enter the property until cleared safe by authorities.
Avoid cleaning soot or moving items before adjuster inspection.
If safe, board up windows or doors to prevent theft or weather damage.
Only perform temporary measures; do not discard damaged items before documentation.
We recommend not filing a claim until a professional assessment occurs. Claims Connection Group will help you make the right decision based on your damage and policy.
You will need to contact a licensed fire restoration company or general contractor experienced in fire damage.

If you already have a trusted contractor, you can use them, but CCG provides guaranteed 5-star contractors, reduced claim cycle times, and one point of contact for the entire process. CCG has contractors whose expertise focuses solely on property fire loss claims.
Take wide and close-up photos/videos of structural damage, soot, and smoke stains.
Create an itemized list of lost contents with estimated replacement values.
Save receipts for emergency repairs, temporary lodging, or essential purchases.
Keep damaged items until after the adjuster inspection.
Record details of the fire incident and firefighting response.
Maintain a log of all insurer and contractor communications.
